p: Proteases are central enzymes in the biology of humans and viruses, and several of them have become drug targets for anti-viral therapy as well as for the treatment of various diseases. There is a number of approved drugs that act as protease inhibitors [ 20]. Among the main proteolytic enzymes are the viral proteases of HIV-1, with more than fifteen approved or on-trial drugs, and of HCV, with more than ten drugs. In addition, a number of drugs against human proteases have been developed. Among them are renin inhibitors, with seven compounds and ACE inhibitors, with more than twenty compounds with applications in the treatment of hypertension; thrombin as well as coagulation Factor Xa inhibitors used as anti-thrombotic agents. DPP-4 inhibitors, gliptins, are used for the treatment of type II diabetes, with seventeen drugs of this type mentioned in the WHO drugs stem book [ 21].
